document.docTitle: Physatocheila chiniana Souma & Ishikawa 2022, comb. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Taxonomic review of the tingine genera Cysteochila, Hurdchila, Physatocheila, and Xynotingis from Japan, with description of a new genus (Hemiptera: Heteroptera: Tingidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Taxonomic review of the tingine genera Cysteochila, Hurdchila, Physatocheila, and Xynotingis from Japan, with description of a new genus (Hemiptera: Heteroptera: Tingidae)

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Cysteochila chiniana Drake, 1942: 5
. Holotype : macropterous ♂ , China : Mt. Tien Sun ; USNM.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Specimens examined. Non-types ( 55 ♂♂ 63 ♀♀ 3 nymphs),
JAPAN : Honshu:
Tochigi-ken, Nasukarasuyamashi, Taki, 3638'55.7" N 14008 '17.4"E, 3.ix.2016 , leg. J. Souma ( 1 ♀ , TUA); Saitama-ken, Saitama-shi, Midori-ku, Daid, 2.vi.2018 , leg. K. Okuda ( 1 ♂ , ELKU); Saitama-ken, Chichibu-gun, Minano-machi, Shimotano, 3605'23.8" N 13907 '00.1"E, 29.v.2019 , leg. J. Souma ( 1 ♂ , TUA); Tokyo Met., Hachioji, Bessho, Nagaike Park, 18.x.2010 , leg. M. Hayashi et al . ( 1 ♀ , TUA); Kanagawa-ken, Zama-shi, Nittajuku, 3528'35.8" N 13922 '45.4"E, 3.vi.2017 , leg. J. Souma ( 2 ♂♂ 8 ♀♀ , TUA); Kanagawa-ken, Atsugi-shi, Funako, 3525'58.3" N 13920 '48.6"E, 6.v.2017 , leg. J. Souma ( 1 ♀ , TUA); as above but 11.v.2017 ( 1 ♂ , TUA); as above but 25.v.2017 ( 1 ♀ , TUA); as above but 7.vi.2017 ( 4 ♂♂ 5 ♀♀ , TUA); as above but 8.vi.2017 ( 3 ♂♂ 2 ♀♀ , TUA); as above but 10.vi.2017 ( 6 ♂♂ 10 ♀♀ , TUA); as above but 12.vi.2017 ( 1 ♂ 6 ♀♀ , TUA); as above but 26.iv.2018 ( 4 ♂♂ 1 ♀ , TUA); as above but 12.vi.2018 ( 1 ♂ 2 ♀♀ 3 nymphs, TUA); as above but 13.ix.2018 ( 1 ♀ , TUA); Niigata-ken, Nagaoka-shi, Suyoshi-machi, Magi For. Rd., 3724'52.2" N 13855 '36.8"E, 30.vii.2018 , leg. J. Souma ( 1 ♂ , TUA). Jogashima Island: 23.v.1994 , leg. M. Hayashi et al . ( 1 ♂ 2 ♀♀ , TUA). Sado Island: Kubota, 27.viii.2021 , leg. J. Souma ( 3 ♂♂ 2 ♀♀ , TUA). Kyushu: Fukuoka-ken, Fukuoka-shi, Chu-ku, NW part of Minami-kôen, 8.v.2021 , leg. S. Imada ( 2 ♀♀ , ELKU); Fukuokaken, Nishi-ku, Motooka, 11–16.vii.2015 , leg. S. Imada ( 1 ♂ , ELKU); Fukuoka Pref. , Setaka-machi, Mt. Kiyomizu-yama, 1.v.1997 , leg. T. Ishikawa ( 1 ♂ , TUA); Chikugo, Kurume, 12.viii.1951 , leg. C. Takeya ( 1 ♀ , ELKU); as above but 25.ix.1951 ( 1 ♀ , ELKU); as above but 23.ix.1950 , leg. S. Miyamoto ( 2 ♂♂ 2 ♀♀ , KUM); as above but 22.ix.1950 , leg. S. Miyamoto ( 2 ♂♂ 3 ♀♀ , KUM); Chikuzen, Fukuoka , Akama, 10.vii.1931 , leg. C. Takeya ( 1 ♂ , ELKU; 1 ♂ , KUM); as above but 20.vii.1931 ( 1 ♂ , ELKU). Tsushima Island: Mt. Ariake, 19.vii.1968 , leg. S. Miyamoto & A. Nakanishi ( 2 ♀♀ , KUM); Kuda, 29.viii.1988 , leg. S. + K. M. ( 10 ♂♂ 5 ♀♀ , KUM). Iki Island: Gonoura-cho, Katabarufure, Takenotsuji, 16–18.vii.2016 , leg. R. Ito ( 7 ♂♂ 3 ♀♀ , TUA). No locality, date and collector data given ( 1 ♀ , KUM). A single specimen without detailed label data has been recorded as
Cysteochila consueta
by Miyamoto (1965) . Two specimens collected from Tsushima Island in 1968 have been recorded as
Cysteochila consueta
by Miyamoto (1976) .

Diagnosis. Recognized among other species of
Physatocheila
by a combination of the following characters: general color brown ( Figs. 8A , 9A , 10A , 11A ); median spine on head extending beyond bases of frontal spines; rostrum reaching posterior margin of mesosternum; pubescence on pronotum less than 0.5 times as long as diameter of compound eye; lateral carinae of pronotum close to each other in anterior part, concealed by paranotum in anterior part; paranota completely covering pronotal disc in anterior part, touching each other, concealing median carina of pronotum, widened posteriorly, bulged upward in posterior part, forming a cyst; cyst of paranotum not concave in posterior part; outer margin of paranotum gently curved outward in its entire length; costal area of hemelytron wider than subcostal area at widest part, less than 0.5 times as wide as discoidal area at widest part, with 2 rows of areolae in its entire length; and subcostal area subvertical, with 2 rows of areolae in its entire length.

Remarks. This species has been supposed to belong to
Physatocheila
by Péricart (1985a) and is in fact affiliated to this genus without doubt because it presents generic characteristics, as described in the Diagnosis section. Therefore, the new combination,
Physatocheila chiniana ( Drake, 1942 )
comb. nov.
, is proposed.

The specimens recorded above matched the photographs of the holotype (https://collections.nmnh.si.edu/ search/ento/?ark=ark:/65665/3c4d64ed011d8459bbc2a94f235d77a4c) and the original description ( Drake 1942 ) of
P. chiniana
comb. nov.
described from China in general appearance.

Physatocheila chiniana
comb. nov.
has been recorded as
C. consueta
(=
P. consueta
comb. nov.
) in Japan by several researchers (e.g. Miyamoto 1965 ; Yamada & Tomokuni 2012; Komatsu 2016 ). The two species are similar superficially, however,
P. chiniana
comb. nov.
can be easily distinguished from
P. consueta
comb. nov.
based on the following characteristics: paranotum completely covering pronotal disc in anterior part, touching median carina of pronotum ( Fig. 8A ); costal area of hemelytron with 2 rows of areolae in its entire length; subcostal area subvertical: metasternum as wide as mesosternum ( Fig. 9A ); and metasternal laminae nearly parallel to each other.

Physatocheila chiniana
comb. nov.
closely resembles
P. fieberi
in the shape of hemelytron but can be distinguished from it by the following characteristics: rostrum reaching posterior margin of mesosternum ( Fig. 9A ); paranota touching each other, concealing median carina of pronotum ( Fig. 8A ); and cyst of paranotum not concave in posterior part.
Distribution. Japan (Honshu, Jogashima Island, Sado Island, Shikoku, Kyushu, Tsushima Island, Iki Island, Shimokoshiki Island), China , Taiwan .

A number of specimens from Japan including
Cysteochila consueta
recorded by Miyamoto (1976) were examined, and all were identified as
P. chiniana
comb. nov.
In addition, the illustrations and photographs of
C . consueta
from Japan provided by previous authors ( Miyamoto 1965 ; Lee 1969 ; Yamada & Tomokuni 2012) represent
P. chiniana
comb. nov.
At least some, and possibly all, previous records of
C . consueta
from Japan seem to correspond to
P . chiniana
comb. nov.
According to Péricart & Golub (1996) , this species has been recorded in Vietnam . However, we could not find the distributional records based on the specimens in the previous papers (e.g. Drake & Ruhoff 1965a ; Jing 1981 ). Thus, the occurrence of
P. chiniana
comb. nov.
in Vietnam is in need of confirmation.
Physatocheila chiniana
comb. nov.
is recorded from Sado and Iki islands for the first time.

Biology. A number of individuals of
Physatocheila chiniana
comb. nov.
were collected from the leaves of the host plant
Causonis japonica
in Japan proper (present study), suggesting that this species is folivorous, similar to many tingids ( Schuh & Weirauch 2020 ).
